Detailed Description

Protocol for a renderer to send information The FWRendererController provides methods that can be used to indicate the occurrence of metric events and change renderer state.

Member Function Documentation

- (id<FWAdInstance>) adInstance

Get rendering ad instance

- (UIViewController *) currentViewController

Return application's current view controller for presenting fullscreen ad views. Player sets it via -[FWAdManager setCurrentViewController:].

- (id) getParameter: (NSString *)  name

Retrieve a parameter

Parameters:
nameThe name of the parameter need to retrieve
- (void) handleStateTransition: (FWRendererStateType)  state
info: (NSDictionary *)  details 

Change state for current renderer

Parameters:
statetarget transition state demanded, available values:

  • FW_RENDERER_STATE_STARTED
  • FW_RENDERER_STATE_COMPLETED
  • FW_RENDERER_STATE_FAILED
detailsdetail info to be passed

  • For FW_RENDERER_STATE_FAILED:FW_INFO_KEY_ERROR_CODE are required. FW_INFO_KEY_ERROR_INFO is optional.
- (CLLocation *) location

Return the current location of FWAdManager objects for geo targeting. Player sets it via -[FWAdManager setLocation:].

- (void) log: (NSString *)  msg

Renderer should use this API to trace all logs

- (MPMoviePlayerController *) moviePlayerController

Return the main video's MPMoviePlayerController object. Player sets it via -[FWContext setMoviePlayerController:]. Video ad renderer renderers upon it.

Availability: iOS >= 3.2

- (BOOL) moviePlayerFullscreen

Return the main video's fullscreen state. Player sets it via -[FWContext setMoviePlayerFullscreen:].

Availability: iOS >= 3.2

- (id<FWContext>) notificationContext

Return id<FWContext> object, which can be used to listen notification using it's notificationCenter and as the sender of any notification which renderer need to post

Note:
for post a notification:
[[[rendererController notificationContext] notificationCenter] postNotificationName:EVENT_NAME object:[_rendererController notificationContext] userInfo:nil];
for listen a notification:
[[[rendererController notificationContext] notificationCenter] addObserver:self selector:(handler) name:EVENT_NAME object:nil];

- (void) processEvent: (NSString *)  eventName
info: (NSDictionary *)  details 

Process renderer event

Parameters:
eventNameEvent to be processed, one of FW_EVENT_AD_* in FWConstants.h
detailsThe addtional infomation need to be processed by AdManager. Available keys:

  • FW_INFO_KEY_CUSTOM_EVENT_NAME Optional. When eventName is FW_EVENT_AD_CLICK, renderer tells the custom click event to be processed via this key.
  • FW_INFO_KEY_SHOW_BROWSER Optional. Force opening/not openning the event callback url in new app. If this key is not provided, AdManager use the setting booked in MRM UI (recommanded).
- (void) requestContentStateChange: (BOOL)  pause

Renderer can use this to request main video to pause or resume, the notification sender is current FWContext object

- (NSArray * /* id<FWAdInstance> */) scheduleAdInstances: (NSArray */*id< FWSlot > */)  slots

Schedule ad instances for the given slots.

- (void) setCapability: (NSString *)  eventCapability
: (FWCapabilityStatus)  status 

Declare capability of the renderer

Parameters:
eventCapabilityOne of FW_EVENT_AD_* (NOT including FW_EVENT_AD_FIRST_QUARTILE, FW_EVENT_AD_THIRD_QUARTILE, FW_EVENT_AD_IMPRESSION) in FWConstants.h
statusTrue if renderer has specified capability or is able to send specified event

Note:
Changing renderer capability after renderer starts playing may result undefined behaviour

- (NSUInteger) version

Renturn the Major version of AdManager, e.g. 0x02060000 for v2.6
